topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0 Post-Alpha Release Build 22: Bringing Up Single VSD VM Manually

section.p: Use the following steps to launch the virtual machine for the required HP DCN Virtualized Services Directory (VSD):

ol.li: Log into the HLM host.
Copy the VSD qcow image, named VSD-3.2.4_134-hp.ova and vsd.xml, to the var/lib/libvirt/images directory.
Execute the following commands: virsh define vsd.xml virsh autostart vsd virsh start vsd

Start a console session to the VSD VM from HLM host using the following command:
virsh console <vsdname> Login creds Login: root Password: Alcateldc Where <vsdname> is the name of your VSD.

Edit /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifcfg-eth0 file to configure a static IP address.
Use the TUL IP for the VSD that is already configured by your lab admin.
For exampleBOOTPROTO=”static” IPADDR=10.20.5.21 NETMASK=255.255.255.0 GATEWAY=10.20.5.1
Restart the Networking service using the following command: service network restart
Edit the /etc/resolv.conf file with the IP address of the DNS name server:nameserver <ip-address>

Update the /etc/sysconfig/network file with the vsd1 host name. The name must be the same that is configured on the DNS server. For example:root@vsd1 ~]# cat /etc/sysconfig/network NETWORKING=yes HOSTNAME=vsd1.dcn-one.helion.cg
Execute the following command in order for the VSD VM host name to be reflected in the /etc/sysconfig/network file: /etc/init.d/network restart
Exit the VSD VM console session, then log back in. You should see the VSD name in the /etc/sysconfig/network file.
Configure an NTP Server for the VSD VM by editing the /etc/ntp.conf file. Commenting out other server list and add your DNS servers. For example:server 10.1.64.20 server 16.110.135.113

Execute the following commands to set the NTP time:/etc/init.d/ntpd stop ntpdate <ntp server> /etc/init.d/ntpd start
Where <ntp server> is the address of your NTP server.
Execute the following command to verify that the NTP servers are listed:ntpq –p
Verify that NTP is synchronized. The synchronization process usually takes 10 to 15 minutes.
After NTP is properly synchronized,execute the following command to install VSD: /opt/vsd/install.sh xmpp.<domain_name> -t s -y

Start a console session to the VSD VM from HLM host using the following command: virsh console <vsdname>
Where <vsdname> is the name of your VSD.

Execute the following command to confirm that you can access VSD. service vsd status

section.title: Logging into VSD node, creating user and applying License

ol.li:
Use a web browser such as Chrome or Firefox to launch the VSD Architect dashboard using the DCM IP and port 8443. For example: https://10.x.x.x:8443/ Default credentials: User Name: csproot Password: csproot Org: csp VSD Server : auto
The main page appears, similar to the following. If you see the following message, you need to apply the VSD license.
To apply the licnese click the Open Platform Configuration tab on the top right corner of the dashboard.
Click the Settings tab.
Click the license icon in the left panel.
Copy and paste the license that you have received.

p.b: Create an OSAdmin user and plug-in user

ol.li: To create the OSadmin user, click the Open Platform Configuration tab on the top right corner of the dashboard.
Click the Settings tab.
Click the User icon on the left panel.
Right-click the csproot user and click Add.
To create a user for the plug-in, click the Open VSP Configuration tab on the top right corner of the dashboard.
Click the CSP Users tab and click +.
Create a user named OSadmin with the password OSadmin. The name and password are case-sensitive. Do not copy and paste from here into the field.
Click Create.
Click the Groups icon to add the user to the CMS Group
Select the CMS Group, then click the link icon click OSadmin.
